intro: Allamanda chelsonii, commonly known as the yellow allamanda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and can grow as a shrub or small tree. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Allamanda chelsonii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
